intro: Aldina polyphylla, commonly known as the many-leaved aldina, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent leaves and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
